item.title: [PI] Party hat fun!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

This is what happens when people have too much time on their hands

Thanks for the fun contrib

edit:

in client.java

[code]int phat = 0;
public int[] phats = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048};

public void cyclePhats() {
CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(this, new CycleEvent()
{

	@Override
	public void execute(final CycleEventContainer container)
	{
		if(phatCycle) {
			if(phat == 6) {
				phat = 0;
			}
			playerEquipment[playerHat] = phats[phat];
			updateRequired = true;
			setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);
			phat++;
		} else {
			stop();
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void stop()
	{
		this.stop();
	}
}, 3);

}[/code]and in public void initialize()

cyclePhats();

just in case of remove <3

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Party hat fun!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Host Gushers:

Is it possible to make it so u can make a different partyhat that’s name is like “partyhat 1002301” that changes its color instead of having all phats changing its color?

Client sided sure.

This is server sided, what it does is cycle though the ID’s of phats and switches through them as you play.

If you don’t want the eco ruined or something because you have a phat that changes colors (so you could put it on when it’s red and sell when white, thus making it not as rare) do this:

  1. Make a second set of p hats via client sided ints, they are exact replica’s of the generic ones. (can change the name if you like ofc, something like “Rainbow Phat” could be accepted, make them all the same name so the end user doesn’t know its other ID’s).

  2. Change the numbers in the above array with the new ID’s you made via client sided, this will make it cycle through the “Rainbow Phats” and not the real ones.

  3. Make the new sets only obtained via 2 methods. This first of your choice, the second via player on player trades (that means it could be staked, sold, looted, etc).

and make sure to never say anything to anyone about the fact that there is this array of phats and each is an individual.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Party hat fun!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

This basically changes the color of the party hat on your head roughly every 1.5-2 seconds (or 3 ticks). I just thought it was something cool to add to my server because I’m tired of looking like everyone else.

in client.java

[code]int phat = 0;
public int[] phats = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048};

public void cyclePhats() {
CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(this, new CycleEvent()
{

	@Override
	public void execute(final CycleEventContainer container)
	{
		if(phatCycle) {
			if(phat == 6) {
				phat = 0;
			}
			playerEquipment[playerHat] = phats[phat];
			updateRequired = true;
			setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);
			phat++;
		} else {
			stop();
		}
	}

	@Override
	public void stop()
	{
		this.stop();
	}
}, 3);

}[/code]

and in public void initialize()

Read full topic
